alert.note: Alert for Benton; Crawford; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 05 at 12:13AM CDT until May 05 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Benton County in northwestern Arkansas... Crawford County in northwestern Arkansas... Washington County in northwestern Arkansas... Sequoyah County in east central Oklahoma... Adair County in northeastern Oklahoma... Southeastern Cherokee County in east central Oklahoma... Southeastern Muskogee County in east central Oklahoma... * Until 100 AM CDT. * At 1213 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near West Siloam Springs to 3 miles northwest of Bunch to 5 miles northeast of Porum, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Fayetteville... Springdale... Van Buren... Siloam Springs... Sallisaw... Stilwell... Cedarville... Mountainburg... Natural Dam... Lowell... Farmington... Prairie Grove... Muldrow... Roland... Elkins... Tontitown... West Fork... Lincoln... Westville... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 7. Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 282 and 328. Interstate 540 mile marker 1 and near mile marker 4. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 77. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for southeastern, northeastern and east central Oklahoma. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
